She was decked out in punk rock garb from a leather jacket coated in patched and spikes, to her long flowing hair with streaks of green dye through her fur and hair, she even had a spiky nose ring.

She also smelt very ‘punk rock’, having the same kind of encompassing B.O. that the bathroom of a punk rock bar/venue might have. Her breath too was very rancid and meaty, but this should’ve been expected with a monster gal, let alone a werewolf. Despite that, she was fairly pretty and seemed to glow in the moonlight. After a nearly, spine-breaking hug, the werewolf left her date down and smiled at him, “I’m really excited about our date. What would you rather do… come back to the, um… Monster World with me? Or did you have a place around here in mind? It’s ok, if your friends see me with you I promise not to embarrass you. But I could take you to a really fun club if you’re interested… you could meet some of my monster friends. They love humans, both to chat with and gobble up, he-heh! But I’m game for anything!” So, where do you go?
111332.title: Wendy the werewolf

choices: Wendy introduces Matt to her other housemates
Wendy tells Buck to leave, she wants the apartment to herself
Wendy grabs some things, then takes Matt to the club she mentioned
1113321.content:
"Wait, there's a whole, separate Monster World?" Matt stammered. It was hard enough to believe that a werewolf nearly twice his size just gave him a hug, but now she's about to claim there's many more like her?

"I mean, sort of? It's complicated. But we can go there and I can show you some of it. Let's start by going to my place. I'm sure you'll love it." She says with unrestrained enthusiasm. "But first, is this a date or what? Pucker up, human."

Matt pulled his head back to see Wendy closing in for a kiss. He barely had time to prepare before a clawed hand at the back of his head stopped him from pulling back further. He winced at his date's foul breath, but there was no going back. He quickly pursed his lips to receive her affection. Wendy had to almost kneel down to get eye to eye with Matt, but she didn't care. She was getting that kiss, even if she had to pin him down for it.

The man finally resigned himself to his fate. He had been chatting with this woman for a few weeks now, he should've expected this. And going by her rather suggestive texts before the date, he should probably prepare for much more too. She stole his thoughts as her stocky muzzle made contact, her tongue prying past his lips almost instantly. Matt's eyes shot open, both at how gross the taste was and how strangely amazing it felt to intimately kiss a werewolf. Her tongue was so powerful, directing his own in a weird little back and forth as the two of them let out mumbling little moans. It was good to hear this was as great for her as it was for him.

"Mwaaaah... Hmmm... Delicious and a good kisser. How have you been single this long?" Wendy mused with a toothy grin. Matt was still busy recovering from the overwhelming assault on his senses when he saw his date search for something in her purse. The small leather satchel was covered in patches, most of which from bands. To his surprise there were a fair few human bands in there as well. He tried not to giggle at the idea of her trying to blend in at a human punk concert. After a few moments she fished out a small collar.

"Put this on." She said, handing Matt the collar. He raised an eyebrow in contempt. The little tag dangling from it read: "Property of Wendy Wolfbottom"

"Wait, property? What the hell is that about?"

Wendy sighed. "Any stray human wandering around in the Monster World is free food for whoever wants them. With that around your neck any hungry monsters have to ask me for permission first. Don't worry, it's not like I want you to be my slave or anything. Unless you're into that of course." She gave him a big wink and smile. Matt was still not too comfortable with the idea of being her 'property', even if it was just to keep up appearances. But this wasn't the moment for cold feet. He wanted to see this Monster World. With a sigh he put the collar on, making the werewolf let out a little squeak of joy.

"You're the cutest, now follow me." She said, taking a few steps back. Matt grabbed his coat, locked the door behind him and followed the large werewolf down the street. Only a few streets further Wendy turned into a narrow alleyway. Matt knew this was a dead end, but something told him his date might have a way. She planted a large foot on a manhole cover and to his amazement it slid open. He peered down and saw nothing but darkness.

"The first time is always scary. Here, allow me." She said, reaching out a hand to Matt. He grabbed it and she quickly pulled him into another tight hug. The man wrapped his arms around his date and closed his eyes as the werewolf casually hopped into the darkness. He felt his stomach turn as it seemed like they were weightless. Moments later it felt like gravity had reversed, the two of them 'falling' upwards. He opened his eyes to see the same alleyway. Puzzled, he looked around. His city was gone, replaced with something out of a gothic fantasy-horror book. The moon shone bright and green, the houses all looked strange and out of place. Everything felt slightly off, but Matt was the most fascinated by how, in spite of everyhing, similar it seemed. He'd expected castles and lairs, but the Monster World looked as mundane as the human world. Of course, the things that went on behind those doors were anyone's guess.

Wendy set him down and motioned for Matt to follow. As they emerged from the alleyway into a quiet street he got his first look at some of the other creatures sharing this world with her. There was a pair of centaurs, one of which carrying a dainty looking sprite on his back. They were all joking and laughing together. A little ahead of him a bored looking fish-man was waiting for the bus. It gave him a strange look as they walked by. They turned the corner and nearly bumped into a sphinx, the large lion-headed beast apologizing to them. The werewolf smiled a little at the awed puppydog eyes on her date. It wasn't much longer before they arrived at the apartment complex she called home.

She unlocked the door and guided Matt inside. The other coats in the hallway immediately made it clear she wasn't living alone. What was also very clear was that none of her housemates believed in hygiene either. The wall of stench that hit him was eye-watering. Sweat, stale burps, unwashed clothes and a general animal funk hung in the air. He hung his coat up and walked into the living room.

Laid out on the couch was a large horse-man. He was watching tv until the human entered the room. He hoisted himself out of his slouched position and raised a curious eyebrow. He wore some tattered shorts and a sweat-stained shirt with the logo of a band on it. He looked muscular, broad-chested and probably easily able to bench-press a small car. The monster's skin was most curious of all. It looked like short gray fur, but it moved in ways that seemed almost liquid.

"Hey bro, you're Wendy's date, right? Nice meetin' ya. I'm Buck." He said, holding out a hand and giving Matt a toothy smirk. It let the human see that this horse-man had some long, sharp fangs along with his usual chompers. Before he could shake the strange monster's hand though Wendy came in and batted Matt's hand away.

"Knock it off, Buck. Matt, Buck here is a kelpie. Their skin is like super glue for anything that's alive." She chided, staring daggers at the horse man. Buck just laughed to himself, putting up his hands. "We've got glue remover around, but I don't need my date held up by his sticky fingers." Wendy continued.

"No touching the horse, got it." Matt thought aloud, following her.
1113321.title: The Monster World sounds interesting to Matt

choices: Go to the punk club
Stick around the apartment or something else
11133211.content:
The towering werewolf smiled and gestured for Matt to follow her deeper into her apartment, “Come on. Let me introduce you to my other roomies. Trust me, they’re way better than Buck.” The Kelpie groaned, “No they’re not.” Wendy took Matt’s hand and walked deeper into the apartment, “Yes they ARE!” Alongside their bathroom, there were four bedrooms… one for Wendy, and three others. Wendy pointed a claw at one door, “So this one’s me.” Then to another, “This is Cindy’s. And Petra’s… and last one is Levi’s.” Matt looked up at Wendy with a look of confusion, “Where does Buck sleep?” The werewolf chuckled, “Oh, yeah. About that… he bunks on the couch, we were barely scraping by on rent for a while until he needed a place and all we had was a fold out couch… but he likes it… and he’s been a good friend… although a bit of a trouble maker.”

Wendy turned her attention back to the doors, knocking her huge paw on one, “I hope everyone’s home. I’d love for you to meet my closest friends. They’re all really intrigued by humans.” Opening the door was a large and muscular Cerberus woman, with bulging, muscular arms that looked as thick as Matt’s body was wide. She had large breasts, a prominent six pack, and wore a torn white t-shirt and cargo shorts… she also had noticeable body odor and stained fur. The three heads that sprouted from between her shoulders groaned as she opened the door. The middle head spoke, “Oh, come on Wendy, I was napping-“ The dog woman stared down in surprise as she noticed the nervous human standing before her, “Is that a human?” Wendy grinned, proudly beaming at her friend, “He’s also my date.”

The devil dog woman grinned, “Oh, you’re quite the lucky little human.” Matt blushed under the canine’s gaze. Petra started chatting up her roommate, “So, where are you two cuties going tonight?” Wendy giggled, “Well… maybe The Wrecker, the old punk club tonight. Or… just around. Matty here has never been to the Monster World so it’s all new to him.” The devil dog smirked, “You’re in for a wild ride if this is your first night here, little human.” She smirked before returning to her room. Wendy happily knocked on the next door, it being answered by a huge, muscular dragon, “Hiya Levi. This is my new boyfriend. He’s a human, his name is Matt.” The towering, green-scaled creature was dressed only in boxer, barely covering up his bulge, aside from that he was a pretty muscular guy despite a chubby bear belly, “Um… hey. Can I eat him?” A chill shot down Matt’s spine. Wendy’s eyes widened, “No. No! No! At least… I mean… not right now. It’s his first night here. Plus, he doesn’t even know you, at least get to know him and ask politely first.”

Now Matt was a bit on edge as he was faced with a dragon who clearly looks like he’s a fan of food, candidly talking about putting him in his belly. Matt was fully aware dating a werewolf would probably result in them discussing monster’s more… predatory leanings towards humans at some point… he was just hoping it wouldn’t come up on their first date. Wendy pushed Matt towards Levi as the human shrunk beneath the big lizards gaze, “Say hi, honey.” Matt quivered, “Um… Hi L-Levi. I-I like your um-scales.” The dragon smirked and chuckled, “Hey, thanks bud. Don’t worry, I won’t eat you. At least not yet. Let’s get you comfortable around monster first.” He winked before retreating back to his room. The last door Wendy led Matt to was Cindy’s room. Wendy obnoxiously slammed her paw against the door, teasingly yelling, “Hey bitch, get your pale ass out here. I got some for you to meet.”

The door was soon answered by a pale vampire chick, dressed in a similar punk rock get-up as Wendy. The vampiress eyed up Matt and smiled, “Wendy, you shouldn’t have. You always know when I’m hungry.” Her jaw dislocated, opening wide enough to easily fit Matt. Her long, pointed tongue drooped off the side of her cavernous maw, as her arms outstretched to grab her human meal. Wendy smacked her friend in the head, “No, dumb ass. This isn’t food, this is my date. This is the human guy I was talking about, Matt.” Cindy’s mouth closed up and she gave Matt another once over, “Oh ok. Heh, sorry about that. I skipped lunch is all. I’m Cindy, nice to meet you Matt.” She outstretched her arm and a shaken Matt accepted it in a handshake. Wendy smiled widely, “Cindy’s been my best friend since I was a wolf pup. We’ve done everything together. So you’ll probably get to know her the most out of my roommates.”

Feeling a little nervous about this whole ordeal, Matt looked up into Wendy’s eyes, “I-Is she gonna eat me?” Cindy giggled and answered, “At some point probably. That comes with the territory of dating a monster. But don’t worry. You won’t be harmed. I know it may be hard to wrap your head around, but a human going into a monsters belly doesn’t exactly end the same way… lets say a steak turns out when it goes into your belly.” Matt was a bit shocked by this, but he didn’t have much time to filter through all this information as the vampire prodded the couple, “So what are you guys doing tonight?” Wendy shrugged, “Hmm, I don’t know. We floated the idea at going to the club… or maybe we could just stick around the apartment and we could all get to know each other together… or… whatever really.” A comforting paw rubbed Matt’s shoulder as Wendy smiled down at him, “What do you think, honey?”
11133211.title: Wendy introduces Matt to her other housemates

choices: The monsters and man ask questions about eachother
Wendy wants Matt to play with her
Wendy lets Petra have some fun with Matt
111332112.content:
"Well... uhm... I'm feeling a little overwhelmed by just the five of you already. I'm not sure I can handle a whole club full of monsters of all shapes and sizes." Matt said sheepishly. Both Wendy and Cindy giggled loudly at his innocence, the werewolf quickly hoisting him off his feet into another crushing hug.

"Awww, isn't he the cutest?" She coos loudly.

"He sure is." Cindy nodded. "It's okay, little man. I'm sure we can throw our own little party in here." She spoke with a sickeningly sweet voice. She then addressed her friend in a more formal tone. "Just give me half an hour to finish up what I was doing and I'll join you two. Unless you want to be alone for your 'date'."

"Naw, the more the merrier." The werewolf guffaws, before looking over her shoulder. "Except for Buck, maybe." The two giggled again.

"I can hear you." He yelled from the living room, laughing at their teasing.

Cindy carefully patted Matt on the head before closing her door to get to work again. Wendy carried him over to her room, stopping at each door to ask if the occupant of the room was interested in joining in. From Levi's room they could hear a strange wet squelching. The dragon just gave her an absent-minded "I'm busy!" The werewolf shrugged, not spending another thought on what he could be doing in there. Matt wondered if the large green-scaled beast was tending to that bulge in his boxers he saw earlier. Monsters have needs too, right? There wasn't much more time to wonder as his date walked over to Petra's door.

"You wanna have some fun with the human in my room?"

"Do I?!" They heard three voices speak in unison, followed by some quick thumps of the devil dog's footsteps. The door swung open and a very eager Petra followed closely behind as the werewolf took Matt to her room. When she opened the door it was clear she was the messiest of the lot, a new wave of stench hitting the man in the face. The distinct notes of clothes that have been mired in sweat and left unwashed for months hung heavily in the air. In the corner sat something that resembled more of a den or a nest than an actual bed. A large heap of clothes, pillows and other soft things, covered in loose fur and stains. The rest of her room was a disorganized mishmash of furniture, unwashed dishes and empty food containers. In the other corner of the room stood a relatively unscathed looking couch. Wendy practically threw herself at it, landing on her belly with a big splash. Matt was the only thing softening her impact and the heavy werewolf slamming into his back drove the air from his lungs.

"Whoops, sorry babe. Got a little carried away." She chuckled, Petra providing three more amused laughs. the werewolf turned around and propped herself up, sitting on the couch with Matt in her lap. He would complain more, but she let her large chest rest on his head and frankly that felt fantastic. The cerberus sat down beside her, giving him a trio of smiles. Right next to the couch, strategically hidden under a stack of pizza boxes and some tattered old clothes, was a small fridge. Petra leaned over towards it and took out a six-pack of beer.

"Alright, now it's a party." Wendy cheered. The devil dog handed her and Matt a can. The werewolf drove a clawed thumb through the top of it and, realizing her date wouldn't be able to match that feat, opened his beer too. He was handed his drink and the first thing he noticed was the heft. Both monsters here stood several feet taller than him and everything around him was built for their size. The cans had to be a full liter each at a minimum. Hopefully they understood if he stuck to only a small number of them. His jaw nearly dropped as he saw Petra open up two cans. Her left and right head each closed their eyes and chugged a can a piece whilst her central head looked more visibly tipsy by the second as she stared at him. He gently sipped from his own drink, the monster beer leaving the weirdest aftertaste in his mouth. Best not to wonder what was in there. Above him Wendy let out a satisfied belch, having finished her drink already.

11133212.content:
Wendy turned her sights back to Buck, she clasped her paws together and grinned sweetly at him, “H-hey Bucky?” The horse man grumbled on the couch, Wendy continued, “Listen, it’s our first date… and I really wanna get to know Matt here, so…” The chubby equine interjected, “Ha-ha, oh I see… you wanna GET TO KNOOOOW each other.” Wendy shook her head and grimaced, “Not like that you perv. We just want to have some alone time together. Plus, you’re stinking up the place Buck.” The horse cackled, “Me? Are you joking? Look at you, ya’ big fat dog, belching and farting everywhere… with your wet dog smell and horrible body odor.” Wendy rolled her eyes, “I’m not THAT bad…”, she looked down at Matt and chuckled nervously, “… am I?”

Before Wendy could press on, the kelpie chuckled, throwing up his hoof-like hands and heaving himself up off the couch, leaving a horse-ass-sized dent in it, “Alright, alright. I’ll let you two lovebirds have your fun… but you owe me Wendy. Got it?” The werewolf chuckled and saluted Buck, “Wolves honor!” The chubby equine went to his room to get some things before heading off. Wendy looked down at Matt with a triumphant smirk, “Welp, we’ve got the whole place to ourselves tonight. We could do whatever we want.” The towering wolf woman dove onto the couch, getting comfortable. She turned to Matt and grinned lustfully, gesturing him to come closer with a claw. Soon enough the human was in the wolf woman’s embrace, sitting on her lap with her muscular arms wrapped around him, her breasts pressing into the back of his head. Her furry body felt particularly warm and comforting. Her wet nose nuzzled the human’s hair, “So sweetheart. What would you like to do together tonight?”

111332121.content:
"Wanna watch a movie? I wonder if you have human movies in the same way we have monster movies." Matt says with a smile. His seat shakes as the werewolf laughs loudly. She tightens her embrace for a moment before giving him an answer.

"Haha, you're funny. We don't really sort movies that way, but I guess you could say that. Honestly we just watch what you guys make most of the time. For all your weird little quirks and weaknesses, you humans know how to make good entertainment. But just one thing. I like my movies violent, none of that sappy romance bullshit."

"Oof, no to those indeed. Wastes of time." Matt agrees, nodding fiercely. "You pick something." He suggests.

Wendy uses the remote to select a movie and soon enough they're both watching some no-name action vehicle celebrating it's R-rating with gratuitous showers of blood and explosions. Matt was having a good time, but Wendy seemed almost entranced by the gory spectacle. She knew this movie would be up her alley, but she hadn't seen it before and she had no idea just how perfectly it matched her tastes. Every new scene was a feast for her eyes, her smile growing with every henchman savagely dispatched on screen. Matt suddenly felt something wet on his shoulder, looking up to see the werewolf staring intently, a strand of saliva dripping onto him.

"Uhm... I guess you like the movie?" He says awkwardly, making her realize she's drooling on her date. Wendy quickly wipes away the spittle from her maw and gives him a toothy grin.

"Oh yes, this is my kind of action. Do you like it too."

"Definitely, it's got great pacing and they really go all out." Matt nods, feeling his date squeeze him a little tighter.

"It's giving me... ideas." She said, leering at him with an unsettling glare.

"Uhhhh..." He mumbles, looking a little afraid.

The werewolf uses the remote to pause the movie and holds her date firmly, she shifts herself on the couch, laying down along the length of it with the human draped on top. She guides his body upwards, his chest pushed against her breasts and his mouth up to her muzzle. She gives him a loving wink before she starts to lick his face. Matt squirms and sputters, trying to resist the sudden slobbery assault, but the wolf woman was showering him affection almost literally. When he opened his mouth to spit out some of the drool that had seeped in she plunged her tongue inside, turning it into an impromptu French kiss. Matt was overwhelmed by the sudden and intense moment. He tried to fight it, but Wendy loved a bit of struggle in her dates. Her strong arms easily held him down as she ravaged the inside of his mouth with her tongue.

Finally she finished up, pushing the man away to inspect the results. His face was shiny thanks to the thick coat of werewolf drool and he was breathing heavily. With a satisfied smile she lowered him enough to have his face hang over her breasts before letting him drop down. His head was wedged into her cleavage, held down with minimal effort as he was simply too tired to keep fighting.

"There, a proper kiss. You just take it easy and recover, because if you keep being this cute I'm gonna want more than a kiss next." She said, smiling from ear to ear. Matt just let out a muffled groan, unsure whether he was regretting his werewolf date or whether this was awakening something in him that compelled him to stay and see just how crazy this might get. Wendy unpaused the movie and watching the remaining 20 minutes or so with Matt held down against her. As the credits roll she turns off the TV. The blood-soaked climax of the film put an enthusiastic glint in her eyes and she was ready to share this enthusiasm with Matt.

1113321211.content:
Truth be told, deep down, Wendy wanted nothing more than to rip off Matt’s clothes and ride him until the sun came up. However, she knew humans don’t work like monsters do. Thanks to the Monstr forums as well as some complimentary brochures about human culture and dating habits, Wendy knew enough to understand humans were less ‘up-front’ as monsters. A few days ago, after getting back from a concert, she felt nervous about her upcoming date. Wanting to impress Matt, she went on a thread in the Monstr forum called ‘Botched Dates - What Monsters Can Learn From Failed Dates With Humans’. The failures were bountiful and filled with different varieties. A Naga woman accidentally hugged her date too hard and sent him to the hospital. Roleplaying as a dragon and a knight, a dragon man accidentally went a bit overboard with his role-play and swallowed his date, even after barfing her back up and apologizing profusely she still hasn’t called or replied in-app for weeks. An especially frisky knoll woman, wanting to tease her female date, pounced on her and started pulling off her clothes with her teeth which resulted in her date elbowing her in the nose and yelling at her.

The last thing Wendy wanted to do was be a tone-deaf, big, stupid monster who takes things way overboard. Maybe they could get rough next time, after giving Matt fair warning of course. These humans were a bit weird, and very prudent, but the werewolf couldn’t deny enjoying her date so far. As the credits started to roll, Wendy made up her mind, she’d still have her fun with Matt, but she’d play it a bit cautious… see how he reacts. As the stunned human laid across her werewolf date, Wendy smirked down at him, showing off her big teeth and giving him a whiff of her monstrous breath, “Hey, babe. That left me feeling a little… frisky, if you know what I mean.” Wendy giggled as she gently pushed Matt down towards her thighs so she could sit up on the couch. She smirked down at the man as she slowly pulled her shirt off, letting her large breasts bouncing in her bra. She sensually ran her tongue across her black lips, as she moved her paws to her back, unclasping her bra and throwing it at Matt’s face.

Once Matt pulled the bra away, he was presented with Wendy’s large bouncy breasts and erect, pink nipples. Matt was shocked as Wendy smirked at him, and sensually ran her claws over her watermelon-sized perky breasts, “You like them?” She moans as she gropes her breasts, “Go on, babe. Give them a feel. We monsters are a pretty frisky bunch, and I’m more than happy to treat you.” She laid back, allowing Matt to do whatever he liked, she just wanted to make sure her date could get into this foreplay himself. As Matt laid there, he could feel a warm, wet patch against him chest, it stunk too. It seems that Wendy was getting pretty turned on. Following Wendy’s suggestion, the human sat up and reached forward, groping her huge breasts in his hands. The feels of the soft, furry orbs was lovely, and made the werewolf groan, “Mmm, now we’re talking. You enjoying yourself Matt?” The nearly hypnotized, drooling human snapped out of his trance upon hearing her voice, “W-what? Oh, of course. Typically a girl doesn’t go topless on the first date though.” Wendy giggled, “Do I look like any of the girls you’d typically date?” Matt chuckled, shaking his head. Wendy smiled, “Well, let’s get a little closer, shall we?” What does the werewolf do now?

"Well, I think it's only fair you know one thing about me, human." She said seductively.

"That you've been holding back all this time?" Matt joked. Wendy bit her lip, wanting to wholeheartedly agree with his statement, but she had a different plan.

"Sort of? But you should be aware, this monster loves being on top."

In a single fluid motion she sat up, her breasts pressed into Matt's face. She grabbed hold of him and scooted a little backwards to make sure her next move would fit on the couch. It wasn't much of a move, more the werewolf simply letting herself slump forward, calmly carrying her date along as she laid on her belly with Matt underneath. If there were any protests, her breasts were silencing them completely. But Wendy had the sneaking suspicion the man wasn't raising a fuss with his head buried completely in her cleavage.

Matt grunted a little as he felt her weight settle on top of him. It was far from painful, but quite overbearing. Though it was hard to argue with the incredible feeling of having his head smothered so thoroughly between those soft globes. The thick fur made them even more comfortable than he ever thought possible. The rest of his body too felt like it was covered in a warm, weighty blanket. Wendy wiggled a little bit, her fluffy underside tickling him gently as she let out a soft moan. He wondered if his joke was closer to the truth that he had thought. Part of him was curious to see what it would be like to have her pull out all the stops, but he feared that might well end up with him in the hospital.

Wendy finally lifted her torso up, propping herself up on her arms to look down at her date's face. He was all misty-eyed, staring dreamily at the gently swaying chest above him. She gave him a wide, toothy smirk.

11133213.content:
Wendy rummaged in her room for a couple of minutes while Matt and Buck waited outside in the living room. The two were most silent until Buck chuckled and turned his attention to Matt, “Say, if all goes well between you and Wendy, at some point could I eat you?” Eat him!? Matt didn’t know how to respond. He’s never been eaten before and certainly was never asked so politely about it. Wendy roared from her bedroom, “He’s my boyfriend Buck, paws-off!” Soon, Wendy emerged from her bedroom with a few touch-ups to her appearance, some gothic, runny, black make-up across the fur on her face and some extra chains on her attire, “Ok, I’m ready. Let’s go to The Carcass!” Wendy grabbed Matt’s hand in a blood-flow-constricting grip and dragged him out of the apartment with her.

They were soon back on the street, walking towards the establishment. The cool night air blew against Matt’s skin and through Wendy’s fur. As they walked, Wendy started some small talk, but Matt was still very interested in the Monster World around him. Wendy smiled, “By the way, thanks so much for going out with me tonight Matt. I really appreciate it. I’ve always wanted to date a human, you humans are so cute, and I’ve always wanted a human guy to cuddle with.” Matt chuckled, “Hey, it’s no problem at all. I’m having a great time. I never thought I’d date a werewolf, especially one as pretty as you.” Wendy grinned ear-to-ear, she had to hold herself back from delivering a back-breaking hug to Matt. But she knew their date would end pretty poorly if they had to spend the night in the ER of a Monster Hospital. She bent down and delivered a loving lick across his cheek.

In no time they had arrived. Once they were I.D.-ed by a tattooed minotaur bouncer they were inside, Matt was given an ‘X’ stamp on his hand, signifying he couldn’t drink. The place was humid from the dozens of warm bodies packet into the Punk Club. Much like a normal club that catered to punk lovers on Earth, there was graffiti on the walls, a ‘dirty’ abrasive aesthetic to the decor, and tons of patrons of all different species wearing make-up, adorned in tattoos and alternative clothing. As the couple tried to squeeze their way between sandwiched bodies they heard a high-pitched squeal, “WENDY! Oh my god, you’re here!” The couple were approached by a giddy shark woman, with some piercings on her snout, a crop-top vest, and tattoos on her exposed thighs, arms and breasts. The two monsters gal hugged each other, “It’s good to see you Matilda. How’s things?”

The giddy shark replied, “Great! My band is doing really well, we’re going on tonight actually. I found this really cool dating app, I think you’d like it, it’s called Monstr and-“ She paused as she noticed Matt, “Hey there! You look tasty.” This put Matt off a bit as the looming shark licked her chops, “Funny you should say that Tilda… because I actually found this little morsel on Monstr. He’s super cute.” Matilda put her hands on her hips and sized-up Matt, “I’ll say. Well, maybe we could hang out after our set. And perhaps Matt here could give me some tips on approaching humans, especially human ladies.”

Matt chuckled nervously, “Yeah, sure. I could help.” She smirked, “Thanks. I think you’re gonna love being with Wendy, she’s one of my best friends, and if I were a human, I couldn’t imagine a better monster girlfriend.” Wendy smiled, putting her paws on her chest, “Tilda! You’re too sweet.” The shark shook her head, “It’s no big deal, but I gotta go get ready.” Matilda scooted her way through the packed bodies back towards the Club’s green room. Now what do Wendy and Matt decide to do?
11133213.title: Wendy grabs some things, then takes Matt to the...

choices: The three of them talk at length about humans
Matilda and Wendy want to 'play' with Matt
Matilda asks if she could practice kissing humans with Matt
111332132.content:
"Come on Matt, let's get tanked!" Wendy said, pulling him with her to the bar. He followed along as best he could, squeezing between the various monsters. Some were his size where others stood much taller. After being dragged along someone's sweaty belly he finally popped free from the mass and stumbled up against the bar. Wendy lifted him up a little onto a stool. The barkeep was a gruff looking minotaur and Matt's glance shot back to the entrance and then to him. He looked identical to the bouncer, straight down to the tattoos. He's sure there'd be some subtle differences, but he didn't get time to look further before the bull man talks to him.

"What'll it be, kid?"

"Uhm, whatever this gets me." Matt showed him the stamp on his hand.

"Yeah, thought so." He rumbled, leaning down and retrieving a bottle of cola from the fridge before putting it down in front of Matt. He turned to Wendy and smiled. "The usual?"

"Yup, bring it on." She said with a toothy grin.

The barkeep went over to the other side of the bar to grab the things needed for her drink, allowing Matt to ask her a question.

"This is bullshit, I'm old enough to drink. Why did I get this?" He said, pointing at the mark on his hand.

"You can handle alcohol, but what they serve here has some extra spice that humans aren't known to handle very well. It can do all kinds of things to ya. Like make you shrink or grow or melt you into a sentient slime. Sometimes you just explode. In the end it generally makes a mess so humans are cut off. Don't worry though, if you really want to get buzzed I got some human-friendly drinks for you back home."

"Eh, alright." Matt pouted. Couldn't she have picked a bar that'd let him drink too? He sipped his cola and turned to watch the bands perform on stage. They went by surprisingly fast. He paid some extra attention when Matilda got on to the stage. Wendy cheered and hollered loudly for her friend and Matt soon found himself joining her. Not just because his date was doing it, but because Matilda had a beautiful voice. The shark woman bellowed each song with vigor and spirit, barely needing the mic to amplify her words. Other patrons were cheering and dancing, overall the mood was great. By the end of her set she was met with raucous applause and cheering from the whole club.

The next band got on and after a few minutes Matilda was down at the bar, sliding into the vacant seat next to Matt. He felt surprisingly safe with a powerful monster sitting on either side of him, even if they both stood several feet taller than him. Matilda reeked a bit of fishy sweat, her time in the spotlight definitely having had an effect and the shark seemingly unbothered by the smell. Wendy had already bought her a drink and enthusiastically handed it to her. "Great job, Tilda. You blew the roof off this place."

"Damn straight. One of these days I'm sure I'll make it big." The shark woman said, staring dreamily at the stage. Matt smirked a little seeing the woman that was so confident on there be such a dreamer behind the scenes. He didn't really know how to gauge monster music but in his world her performance would be considered pretty great. Though humanity probably wasn't quite ready for a music star that could swallow people whole.

Soon the conversation turned to him, with Matilda jumped straight onto the most important question on her mind. "So did you two... you know..." Her broad grin nearly made Matt spit out his drink. Wendy just laughed. "Hah, not yet, but maybe if he's in the mood he'll get some tonight."

"Oh, you tease." Matilda giggled before turning to the human. "Little tip for ya, Matt. If she starts growling, just snarl back at her, it's a real turn on for werewolves."

Matt just smiled awkwardly. He had no idea if the shark woman was genuinely trying to help him or just messing with him. Either way, the two monsters each ordered another drink before Matilda announced that she had a back room available for the three of them. A somewhat less noisy place where they could talk normally seemed like a good thing to Matt, who could tell that the shark woman had so many questions on the tip of her tongue for him. Wendy mutters something to the barkeep that her date doesn't quite catch and the two get on their feet. They both take one of Matt's hands, holding their drinks in the other and pushing through the crowd and into the back room.

It's not much to look at. Some dim lights, a ratty couch and some equally flimsy-looking chairs, all of which far larger than furniture Matt is used to. They were meant for monsters even taller than the two he's with. The walls were covered in band posters and the door creaked as Matilda closed it behind them. The music could still be heard thumping down the narrow hall, but it gave them some room for conversation. Moreover, it gave them some privacy.
111332132.title: Wendy wants to party and drags Matt to the bar

choices: Lily, a succubus
Annahet, a lesser fertility spirit
keep looking for more monster ladies
112.content: Chad rifled through the available options on Monstr quickly. Some of these bitches looked like they might actually be able to keep up with him for a change. Even more surprising is that it takes remarkably little sweet talk to get exactly what he wants out of them. Then again, looking at what he's matched up with, that probably shouldn't be a big shock. Who will be visiting him tonight?
112.title: Chad

choices: She's famished, dinner doesn't sound bad
She tackles Chad onto his bed
Reader's Choice
1121.content:
Chad was stood in front of a mirror checking himself out when a strange smell filled the room. It was hard to place where it came from precisely, but it distracted him just long enough send a shiver down his spine. "I don't need this, I got a hot babe waiting to meet big Chad..." He mumbles to himself, turning his attention back to the mirror.

"What the f..." He stammers as he suddenly sees another figure standing behind him in the mirror. She was roughly as big as Chad, but her skin was a deep purple and she had two short black horns growing out of her head. A slim tail could be seen whipping around behind her. But what stood out most was her outfit. She made strippers look modest, wearing a few strings and scraps of cloth held together by little more than wishful thinking. It did nothing to hide her enormous rack. But even with those beauties staring right at him he couldn't muster more than a shocked yelp at seeing them suddenly appearing in his bedroom.

He snaps around to look at the intruder directly, but the room was empty. Was his mind playing tricks on him or did this girl put a spell on him already? Suddenly something grabbed his shoulder and Chad nearly jumped out of his skin. Leaping away from the mirror he looks back to it to see the girl step through it like it was a portal. She giggles loudly and reaches out her purple hand.

"Hey there, I'm Lily. Are you Chad?"

The man scrabbles back onto your feet, refusing to take her hand until he's back up again. Finally he shakes it, trying his best to look charming. "Hey babe, that was one hell of an entrance. You shoulda told me you would come through the mirror, could've cleaned it real quick."

She grins from ear to ear. The cocky ones were always more fun to play with. She spoke softly, her words sweet as honey. "So Chad... what convinced you that dating a demoness from the circle of lust was a good idea? Or was that just 'Big Chad' that swiped right?" She shot a salacious look at his crotch before looking him in the eyes again.

"I mean... I wanted to date someone that could keep up with me..." He stammers, still trying to sound cool. Finally recovering from the initial shock of standing in front of an actual real succubus Chad gives her a sly smile. "Think you could handle a challenge like that?"

"Buddy, you've got no idea of the things I 'handle'." She scoffed, widening his smile further.

"Damn I love a woman with confidence. Always like to see them sputter and tap out." He adds, thrusting his hips. Lily didn't dignify that statement with a response and just laughed loudly. She then put on her most serious glare.

"Okay big man, you think you're all that? How about a little challenge then? If you can make good on your claims and prove too much for me to handle tonight I'll let you visit the circle of lust. You can make your every lewd desire a reality with no consequences. No act too perverse and an unlimited supply of demons ready to join in at your beck and call." Chad's eyes widened at the mere thought of such a reward. Lily raised her finger. "But. If I can handle everything you've got and still ask for more, you're coming with me to the circle of lust to be my boytoy for a month. It'll be mostly the same, only I will be in charge of what happens to you." Her long slim tail cracked like a whip. He'd never felt this aroused in his life. She held out her hand, waiting for his response.

"You're on!" He said proudly, shaking her hand. Lily smirked, whispering under her breath. "Like stealing candy from a baby..."

"Now then, you want to start by ordering some food, maybe cozy up a little? Or shall we get straight to action?" Chad offers. The succubus ponders her options for a moment.
1121.title: Lily, a succubus

choices: Palisades the dragoness
Mandy the kitsune
Others
113.content:
At the moment, Carl was living his best possible life. He only graduated high school a year ago, but instead of all of those sheep who went off to college to get suffocated in debt, he had built a huge internet following with his Deadman’s Debunked brand; what was once an urban exploration Youtube channel, where he and his high school friends stupidly and dangerously did urban explorations in dilapidated and crumbling ‘haunted’ hospitals, prisons and the like, had turned into a paranormal debunking channel after he unmasked a local ghoul to be a disgruntle school janitor. With the catapulting popularity of his channel he capitalized on it by shifting his content more towards paranormal debunking, whether he was traveling with friends to haunted and paranormal locations, or debunking paranormal tv shows from the safety of his ‘studio’ (aka, apartment bedroom). Still, the ad revenue he was generating was quite impressive for someone for his age and he couldn’t complain.

This week started like any other, he was hunched over his desk, looking through his notebook filled with video ideas, from making fun of witches and wiccans, to debunking SCP and cryptid sightings. Carl ended up scrolling through some paranormal internet forums until he came across a chat-thread entitled “New ‘Monstr’ dating app hits mainstream platforms, says you can date real monsters! Bogus or Real?”. Carl scrolled through the thread that almost unanimously said it was stupid, with a few users egging others on to download the app and try to get laid with a harpy. This new app would be easy pickings for Carl. He’d get a great series of videos out of him dating the various ‘monsters’ on the app. At best they were just normal people and at worst adamant, socially awkward cosplayers.

Carl quickly downloaded the app and started writing some scripts for his new videos based on the app. Once Carl opened the app for the first time he noticed a screen that asked him to distinguish himself as a human or monster. He filled out all of the appropriate personality traits, physical descriptions and interests before looking for a match. Soon the app created his profile and brought up a list of female monsters in his area looking for a guy like him. These profile pictures for these monster chicks were fairly convincing… then again, photoshop can do wonders. There were a few that caught his eye quite a bit. There was Palisades, a western dragoness with turquoise scales, a fit physical physique and a similar interest in video games. There was Mandy, a kitsune woman deeply into spirituality who works as a local healer and nurse. And there was Katrina, a vampiress, who loves horror movies and humans who aren’t afraid to share a coffin with her. There were still a few more pages worth of monster matches, but will Carl continue to look for a supernatural date or pick one of these lovely ladies?
113.title: Carl

choices: Katrina the vampiress
Mira the giant spider
More monsters
1133.content:
Carl still had Katrina to consider. She seemed almost too relatable, it had to be an elaborate catfish. It would make for good content either way. But there were more potential candidates that caught his attention. One of them was Mira, a giant spider. From the pictures on her profile it looked like someone had put their pet tarantula on a number of miniature sets to make it look enormous. Carl chuckled when he imagined how much effort it must've taken for someone to set all those shots up. They looked remarkably convincing too. It seemed almost sad to go for something this easily disproven, but it'd make for a nice quick piece to put on his channel. Maybe he could even get more details on how this guy or gal managed to get their pet spider to pose for things.

Of course there were still pages full of others to consider too.
1133.title: Others

choices: Option 1 - Lounge Around With Carl In Her Belly
Option 2 - Show Carl What Real Monsters Look Like
11331.content:
One of the ladies that Carl had found and chatted with was a vampiress named Katrina. She was supposedly a few centuries old, but she appeared to be in her early twenties with chalk-white skin, short black hair, fiery red eyes and a set of fangs as your typical vampire would have. She was a bit chubby in all the right places, fairly well-endowed, and despite dressing in very dark, gothic clothing her profile stated she had a very bubbly and upbeat personality, enjoying pop music and romantic-comedies. Her profile also states despite some incorrect vampire lore, she isn’t harmed by the sun, and she actually quite enjoys basking in it, summer being her favorite season.

She’s also a very charitable vampire, volunteering for the Red Cross, for no other reason than to get closer to humans and get to know them better. Many staff and other volunteers find it a bit weird she has an almost photographic memory of the human circulatory system and almost sickly pale skin but she just tells them she has a skin condition and they mostly buy it. Unfortunately, before Monstr, Katrina had tried to use her volunteering as a way of hitting on humans, but every time she’d reveal herself to be a vampire they’d either run away or some of the bolder ones would try to kill her. Needless to say, she was elated that there’s now an app she can use to find humans who are more than willing to date a vampire. Katrina was giddy on her trip over to Carl’s apartment.

She quickly got out of her cab as she made her way towards the door of his apartment. She knocked on the door, grinning ear-to-ear, showing off her fangs. She was dressed in fish-net stockings, a black bikini bottom and t-shirt to match, with blood-red lipstick. Soon enough, Carl answered the door, “Hey, you must be Katrina.” The vampire nodded, “Yep, that’s me. I’m so happy to meet you. I don’t get to date a lot of humans who are interested in vampires. Most are afraid of me.” Carl chuckled, “Well come right in.” He gestured for Katrina to come in, as she stepped in she noticed Carl’s video set-up with a desk, green screen, lighting and an expensive camera. She eyed it up with amusement, “W-what’s this? Do you make Youtube videos?” Carl chuckled and rubbed the back of his neck, “Y-yeah, I do. That’s actually why I asked you to come.”

Katrina stared back with a look of confusion, “W-what? I’m sorry, I can’t. I’m camera shy. I wouldn’t even show up, being a vampire, I don’t show up in photos or videos sadly.” Carl retorted, “But you’re not a vampire.” Katrina’s eyes widened, “W-what!? Of course I am. It said my species in my profile and everything.” A sour lump of worry dropped into Katrina’s stomach, was this some kind of misunderstanding? Carl continued as he pulled out a wet wash-cloth, “I’ve gotta hand it to you, you did a really convincing job with your costume, but this site isn’t real. It’s a fraud, you can’t date monsters cause monsters aren’t real. I mean… heh-heh, maybe a nine year old would think this is real, but anyone who’s potty trained could tell this is at best a site for cosplayers, and at worst some kind of credit card front.”

Katrina wasn’t exactly sure what all of this meant, but she knew that Carl didn’t seem to actually want to date her, “W-wait so… you don’t want to go out with me?” Tears weld up in Katrina’s red eyes. Carl didn’t reply and instead took the wash clothes and mashed it against Katrina’s face, trying to wash off her ‘make-up’, of course… nothing came off, she was as bone-white as ever. Carl grunted, “Why won’t it come off?” Katrina snarled, “Cause I’m really a vampire you moron!” Carl replied, “No you’re not.” Having been fed up, Katrina grabbed his arm and sunk her teeth into it. Carl yelped, more in surprise than fear. Katrina gulped down some blood before letting him go, Carl stumbled back, clutching his arm as Katrina licked her lips, “Mmm, you’re Type A-, that’s my favorite flavor!”

Carl fearfully backed up, “G-get away from me.” Katrina smirked, “No, I don’t think so. I’m not done with you.” As the human tried to back away, Katrina pounced on him, opening her mouth up nice and wide. Carl’s world grew dark as he passed out from fright. What felt like hours later Carl awoke, only this time he was in complete darkness, her could hear wet squelching all around him, and it was hot, humid, wet and cramped. The human tried his best to move but he was curled up in a ball with fleshy walls all around him. The air in here was also humid a smelt/tasted disgusting, he gagged. Fearing for his life, Carl whimpered, “W-where am I?” He was answered by a thunderous belch and his prison shaking, “BBBBBWWWWWWOOOOORRRRPPPPP!” Katrina laid back on Carl’s desk chair, sitting at his computer desk with his Youtube channel on-screen. Her belly was bloated into a bulbous dome with her date wiggling inside.

Katrina giggled as her stomach came to life, she teasingly poked her big belly, “Hey there. You’re awake. Enjoy you’re nap?” Carl asked with fear in his voice, “Where am I?” Katrina ripped another unlady-like belch, “Ah, I love the taste of humans. You’re in my belly silly.” Carl freaked out, struggling in her fetid stomach, “YOU ATE ME!?” Katrina giggled, grabbing her belly and sloshing it about, “Well, humans are a vampires favorite. I don’t know what to tell ya’. I was hungry, so I had dinner.” Frustrated and filled with horror, Carl replied, “YOU ATE ME CAUSE I DIDN’T THINK YOU WERE A VAMPIRE?” The vampiress rolled her eyes, “Well, not exactly. More that you set me up to embarrass me, or expose me. I’m fine with dating humans who don’t know I’m a vampire right away, I have problems with humans who think I’m a joke and want to take advantage of me.”

Katrina snarled, giving her belly a slap, letting it slosh about like a waterbed. She scrolled through his videos as a grin grew on her lips, “Ya’ know, you’re quite the photogenic guy Carl, you’ve got a real good eye for cinematography and shot composition and color, plus you look cute… it’s a shame you don’t use that talent for more… noble pursuits. I can’t imagine making debunk videos is something you wanna do at 80, what with you humans and your pathetically short lifespans.” Carl just punched and kicked and wiggled in her belly, “Are you going to let me out now?” Katrina chuckled, standing back up, watching her gut slosh about, “Hah! Nope! Unless you’re sorry… and I mean genuinely sorry, I think some well deserved punishment is in order.” Carl struggles some more in her belly, “Y-you can’t do this. I’m a human being.” Katrina rolled her eyes and put her hands on her wide hips, “Uh-huh, and I’m a vampire.”

Option 1: Katrina lounges in his place for a little while longer, rummaging through his Youtube channel and actively making fun of his videos with Carl as a captive audience. Eventually, Carl starts to soften, realizing his mistake and apologizes, asking Katrina if they could forget about all of this and continue with a real date this time.

Option 2: If Carl likes debunking monsters so much she’ll give him one hell of a case to debunk. With Carl still trapped in her belly, Katrina returns to the monster world and decides to still have their ‘date’ but educate Carl on monsters and the monster world. Perhaps he’ll have a better respect and appreciate for monster-kind after spending some time in their world… and possibly in some of their stomachs. If Carl has a change of heart, maybe this date wasn’t such a waste after all… but if he remains stubborn she could always just burp him back up in his apartment after some ‘fun’ and shenanigans and look for a kinder, more understanding human boyfriend.
11331.title: Katrina the vampiress

choices: Carl inspects the spider webs
Mira emerges from the trees and introduces herself
Carl is still alone, but he can't shake the feeling something's watching him
11332.content:
Carl's curiosity couldn't be held back any more after reading through Mira's profile. Someone had gone through a lot of effort with this and it was a prime opportunity to debunk something for views. He started chatting with this spider and was quick to discover that whoever was behind this was willing to go all the way. 'She' spoke like many other girls, albeit with occasional grisly details like talking about devouring a deer in the forest. After a few days a date was agreed upon. For obvious reasons she didn't want to show herself near any human spots. People were afraid enough of spiders as is, one of her size would cause a panic. Carl chuckled and played along, agreeing to meet her near her home in the forest. Not a word was mentioned about him making a video about this date, as he didn't want her to get cold feet.

He packed his recording equipment, already having a plan of action for this. Going by the photos on the profile, this beast would have to be the size of an elephant. There was no real way of recreating that with animatronics or an elaborate suit outside of involving a whole movie studio. So their tactic was probably to scare him so badly that he would turn tail and run before he'd get a chance to reveal that it was all fake. He'd been there before and it made for some of his most-watched videos. Staring down the horror and pointing a camera at it for a few seconds would often have the illusion come crashing down, followed by some folks either scurrying off or getting belligerent.

In the back of his head one scary thought did crop up. What if she was the real deal? Carl wasn't afraid of spiders, but one that big would definitely give him pause for thought. Nah. It was biologically impossible for a spider to be that big. He couldn't remember exactly why, but he's certain he watched videos about why bugs aren't bigger these days. Despite all that there was a noticeable pang of dread in his gut as he drove to the forest. What if he really had stumbled upon the genuine article? He laughs it off, parking at the forest's edge.

With a camera in one hand and his phone showing directions in the other Carl sets off. The coordinates she had given him guided him along a narrow trail only a few hundred meters into the forest. Dusk was already setting in and the trees around him seemed to get spookier by the minute. He shook his head, trying to stay focused on his recording. Any moment now there'd probably be an elaborate jumpscare and shortly thereafter Youtube gold.

There was a dim light ahead and the forest cleared. Carl was as ready as he'd ever be. Several trees were covered in large webs, the strands glistening in the fading light. Smaller branches had been partially snapped to further give the impression that something huge had done this. It was a very impressive effort he had to admit. But the one thing yet unseen was Mira herself. Were they hoping this scene alone was enough to send him running? They'd have to do better than a well-dressed stage to scare him.
11332.title: Mira the giant spider

choices: Mira cuts him free
Mira wraps him up in a cocoon of webs
Mira leaves him trapped and scolds him
113321.content:
A lot of work had gone into making this little glade look like the home of a giant spider, but what stood out most to Carl were the webs draped all over the trees. They shimmered and glistened just like oversized spider string would. He struggled to imagine how the people behind this trick managed to get them all the way on top of these trees.

"Well, I'm here, but so far not a giant spider in sight. But if you look closely, you'll see that these webs are just made of clear rubber or some other plastic. They look super real, but that ain't gonna fool me." He spoke to himself, commenting for his video. He walked up to the most central tree, eager to demonstrate his cleverness. He grabbed one of the thick threads of webbing and raised an eyebrow. "They've even covered the lower webs in some sort of slime to simulate the stickiness. I'm impressed." He chuckled haughtily. He'd seen through this illusion with ease. But when he tried to pull his hand free the webbing barely yielded.

"Really? Glue?" Carl's voice gained a tinge of panic as he tried to maintain his composure for the video. Right now it felt like a prank gone wrong. He tried to let go of the sticky strand, but his hand was stuck. Thinking fast, the man puts his camera down and grabs his pocketknife to cut himself free. But the webbing proved immensely tough. The blade struggled to cut through it and Carl was getting visibly upset. He'd probably have to go to a hospital to get this shit removed from his hand. If he ever found out who was behind this sick joke he'd have some very pointed words for them. He grumbled, cutting through the strand on the other side of his hand. He was nearly free when he slipped, the knife flying from his hand and his arms getting caught in several more strands.

"Dammit!" He cursed, trying to free himself. But at this stage he was hopelessly trapped. His camera was still on the floor, pointing up and recording. "Well, whatever sick bastard came up with this had better come on out before I take this to the fucking police!" Carl shouted into the trees, his temper fractured. His blood ran cold when he heard an ominous hiss in response.

The man turned his head as best he could, restrained in the sticky webs. From the corner of his eye he could see something large moving. Heavy taps on the floor came closer. The fading light of dusk made it hard to see but the long, chitinous limb approaching him was clear as day. Carl fought hard not to panic, holding on to his beliefs that this was all some elaborate trick.

"Well, looks like 'Mira' is finally here. Maybe 'she' can help me get out of this crap." He joked. But the limb did actually seem able to cut through the thick strands with ease whilst not getting caught on them. One arm was freed, but instead of releasing the other she pushed her date around, shoving his back into the webs, flipping him over so he could see her.

Carl's heart skipped a beat as he looked straight into the eight unmoving eyes of a gigantic spider. Her huge body covered in a rigid brown carapace. Elaborate markings covered most of her. Some might have even been drawn on as her version of make up. Her jaws moved intricately, large fangs gleaming right in front of him whilst all the other twitchy little parts dripped with some sort of saliva. Every detail was there. From the tiny scratches and scuffs on her exoskeleton to the strange bobbing and moving of her body. More and more the thought began to intrude that this might not be a trick. Maybe, against all odds, he really was looking at a spider the size of a bus. And he was caught in this monster's web.

"Well well well... You must be my date. Carl, isn't it? Do you call all your potential girlfriends 'elaborate tricks' before you've even introduced yourself, or was I just lucky?" She spoke bitterly. Carl's eyes nearly bulged out of his skull as he struggled to grasp that this huge spider just talked to him. Worse yet, she didn't seem very pleased with his commentary so far.
113321.title: Carl inspects the spider webs

choices: Carl agrees to the date
Carl is honest with Mira, he'd rather not date her
Mira makes the decision for him
1133213.content:
"I'd hoped that the first man brave enough to date me would be less rude than you, but here I go overestimating you humans once again. 'Ooooh, she's a giant spider, she must be fake.' Meanwhile every pair of tits on that damn app gets ten times the attention, no matter how little sense it makes." Mira grumbled loudly, saliva splattering in Carl's face. With the hesitation in his voice hidden as best he could, the trapped man finally stammers out a reply.

"S... Sorry."

"Yes, you better be sorry. You know what happens to humans that get lost in the woods and never seen again? I happen to them and right now I'm tempted to let you experience firsthand what happens next."

"I... Please don't eat me..." Carl blubbered, trying not to cry.

Seeing what might be a pang of guilt in the sad looking man Mira leans back. She takes a deep breath before swaying forward, her face closer to him than ever before.

"Okay, let's try this one more time. I want you to be completely honest with me. Now that you know I'm really a giant spider and not some prank gone wrong... Would you still go on this date? Or did you only text all those sweet things to me to get a video out of it? You're probably in over your head at this point, so I'll begrudgingly understand if you're scared off by all this. I'll be sad about it, but I'll take you to the forest's edge if you'd rather go home now."

Her gaze was unflinching, but somehow Carl could see the disappointment in her eyes. Was he really the only one that had reacted to her? All this time he thought he was chatting with some pranksters. He remembered some of those messages. And now the girl he'd sent them too had to learn now that he wasn't serious about them... In spite of being trapped in her web, he couldn't help but feel sorry for the giant spider. She made her existence in these woods sound really lonely. And he'd gone and made her feel even more undesirable, writing her off as a prank.

He had to admit though that she was completely right about one thing. He was in over his head in ways he couldn't imagine. Faced with the thought of actually having to go on a date with a spider the size of a bus and the risk of being eaten very real and present. He wanted to lie to her and say he was okay with it, mostly out of guilt. But honestly, her offer of letting him walk out seemed tempting too. She wanted him to be honest with her, but he didn't want to risk hurting her feelings even more. Should he put up with this date just to save his skin? His inner conflict boiled over until Mira finally interrupted his train of thought.

"Well... what will it be? Are you willing to give this date a chance or is it better for us to part ways?"
1133213.title: Mira leaves him trapped and scolds him

11332132.content:
Carl stared into Mira's intimidating visage and tried as best he could to maintain his composure. Even so she could hear the tremble in his voice. He spoke as clearly as his fear let him.

"If I'm fully honest, you're right. This went to places I couldn't have imagined and I never thought I'd be facing a real spider of your impressive size. I'm struggling to imagine what a date between us would look like. What can I even offer you romantically? So I don't think it'd be fair to you for me to keep pretending like a date is a good idea. I'm sorry I hurt your feelings." He let out a weary sigh afterwards, feeling a burden slide off his shoulders. Now he could only hope Mira would honor her offer.

She sighed too, lifting a slender leg and swiping it towards the trapped man. Carl let out a panicked yelp before realizing he was unharmed and the webs binding him were cut loose. Some of the sticky silk still clung to him, but at least he could move again. The giant spider turned around and pointed at a narrow trail amidst the trees.

"Let's go. That path will lead us back."

Carl didn't need to be told twice and with a brisk pace they set off. His nerves were still tingling, the man trying to keep his composure as her heavy footsteps thundered around him. Even eight legs did little to mitigate the weight of her step. After a little while he slows down and turns to her. Hesitantly he asks:

"Was I really the only one to contact you?"

"Yeah." Mira snaps back, pausing before she elaborated. "We aren't exactly sought after by monsters outside of our own species. And humans tend not to want to hang out with even tiny spiders, so ones that could eat them like snacks probably aren't the most desirable either."

The man felt even more ashamed. He'd really gotten her hopes up only to reveal that he thought this all to be an elaborate prank. When the forest began to thin out and the edge approached he stopped.

"Hey, what are you doing?" Mira asked curtly.

"I don't want you to be lonely tonight because of me. A date might be a bit much, but would you be willing to just... hang out for a bit? Maybe get something to drink?"
11332132.title: Carl is honest with Mira, he'd rather not date her

choices: Mira carries Carl back to civilization
Mira offers to take Carl to her home for the night
Mira waves Carl goodbye, but forgets to return him to civilization.
113321321.content:
If the giant spider had eyebrows they'd be raised by now. She still wasn't fond of the little man that had tricked her, but he seemed genuinely regretful of what he'd done. Not many humans would even contemplate an offer like this, especially to someone like her. It tickled her curiosity.

"That's very kind. Alright, little morsel. But I think it's better I pick a place to get these drinks. I don't think many human bars are gonna serve me anything."

"Hah, only because you'd be able to down their whole supply and only feel a little buzzed." Carl jokes back. She chitters in a way he'd not heard before. Was that a laugh? The giant spider calmed down and with a cheery voice she spoke.

"I'm gonna put you on my back though, otherwise it'll take forever to reach this place."

Carl tried to remain calm as two long limbs extended towards him, taking hold of his torso and lifting him off his feet. The idea that a spider of all creatures had this kind of strength over him was terrifying. But he made a promise and Carl Hessen is a man of his word. He was set down on top of her large abdomen. It was covered in thick spine-like hairs, which he grabbed hold of. Mira set off into the woods towards her destination. He could scarcely believe how fast this monster could run. The trees seemed practically non-existent in her path as she effortlessly scurried over and around them. Before long an exceptionally large tree began to poke out from the forest's canopy. He was surprised to never have seen it before. But by now he was also deep into the forest. When he looked around he realized that there wasn't even the most distant glimmer of light of any city to be seen. There was a strange beauty to just how far removed from civilization he was.

Mira arrived at the base of the tree, revealing that it was a large gathering spot for all manner of mystical forest creatures. A few of them gave her a polite wave. Carl was awestruck, timidly waving back. Before today he'd thought oversized animals like Mira were a trick, but now he was surrounded by them. Mice the size of horses, a deer as tall as a house. Several fox spirits lounging in a corner busily chatting with eachother. Numerous half-animals like centaurs, harpies, nymphs and more everywhere. Surrounding the base of the tree was a bar, staffed by satyrs. It looked grown out of thick vines, topped with flat river stones for a fitting natural aesthetic.

"The usual?" One of the bartenders asked the giant spider.

"Make it a double. And a tiny one for my friend." She pointed a long limb up at the human on her back before picking him up and setting him down beside her.

The satyr leaned over the counter to the little man. Though the bar was small for someone the size of Mira, it still stood too tall for the human to even look over the counter. The bartender spoke an eldritch command and gave him a smile. Suddenly vines sprung from the ground, forming a seat beneath Carl and lifting him up. It shaped into a bar stool, even adding steps for an easy way down later. The man was impressed, giving a thankful nod. The bartender responded by putting a mug of ale in front of him. A large minotaur bartender came around to put a large vat of beer down for Mira.

"Cheers." Carl said, raising his drink. Mira responded in kind before downing the entirety of the vat in one go.

Her second vat was already on the way as the man tried his own brew. It tasted very sweet, distinct notes of honey and fruit tickling his palate. He saw the bartender nod knowingly at him, the joy in his face clear to read. He turned his attention back to the giant spider.

"Wow, I didn't know spiders were so fond of beer." He joked. He'd not even gotten halfway through his drink before Mira had downed the second vat, ordering another.

"Heh, there's a lot you humans don't know about us."

The two chat back and forth about their lives. Mira has a few hearty laughs as he explains his occupation. Listening to the stories of fake monsters being uncovered and how clumsy some of these illusions were. In return she regaled Carl with all the times she'd subtly guided lost wanderers back to civilization. She also guided many into her belly, but she left that part out. After some time and more beer the two finally felt done at the bar.

1133213213.content:
"Thank you Carl." The giant spider murmured after her tenth barrel of ale.

"For what?" He asked, puzzled by her gratitude. After what he put her through, this was the last thing he'd expected.

"For keeping me company. I'm no stranger to heartbreak, but there aren't many humans out there that would do what you did."

"Aww, don't mention it." Carl blushed.

"Cards on the table, I really thought about eating you back there. That tasty little body of yours in my jaws..." She salivated a little at the idea, oblivious to the now very nervous looking man.

Carl was desperate to spin this story away from her eating him before she got any ideas. "I think you've had quite enough to drink. Maybe we should be heading home."

"Mmmyeah, any more and the hangover will be monstrous." Mira said, chittering at her own pun. She paid their tab, Carl's part of the bill barely a fraction of hers. She then leaned in towards the human, her beery breath washing over him. He tried to shuffle away on his seat, but she just got closer until her weird looking spider mouth bumped against his cheek. It was the weirdest kiss Carl had ever experienced. He prayed to whoever would listen that this was just a kiss, especially after her talking about eating him.

"Well, I'm gonna head out then. I'll see you around, Carl." She said, standing up and skittering away.

"Mira! Wait!" Carl shouted after her, but the drunk giant spider didn't hear him. The man gulped. He'd just been left here, with no way back to civilization. Suddenly it felt like all eyes were on him. A lost human, helpless and alone. More than one of the patrons gave him a predatory leer. He dreaded to think how many of these people made a meal out of humans like Mira did.

"Oh my, looks like you're stranded." The barkeep mused aloud with a sly grin. He poured Carl a pint and put it down in front of him. "Here, this one's on the house."

"Thanks." Carl replied, taking the drink and sipping on it. Hopefully Mira would realize what had happened and return. But as the minutes ticked by it became increasingly unlikely. There would be nothing else for it. He was going to have to find his way home and he would need to rely on the strangers around him for help. He was too deep in the woods to ever make it back alone. But which of these spirits and half-animals could be trusted? Some looked as likely to guide him into their belly as they did to guide him back home.

Carl gulped. The staff were all too busy to assist him in getting home. It would have to be one of these strangers. He'd given up hope that Mira would remember him in her drunken stupor. He saw several of the other patrons already eyeing him up. A large bear woman licked her chops and gave him a big toothy grin when their eyes met. The man blushed a little. She looked ready to take him with her... in her belly. Probably best to skip her.

A few tables over a gruff looking centaur chugged down a small keg of ale. He seemed kind of lonely, sighing deeply as his drink emptied. The handful of empty kegs near him getting another member added to their ranks. His whole body was chocolate brown with a few stray spots of white. He looked capable of getting him home, but Carl had heard all kinds of stories about what centaurs got up to in the woods. With so many different versions of them it was hard to tell if he would be a benevolent forest spirit or the brutal molest-all-humans type. It was risky, but at least he didn't look so eager to do strange and possibly awful things to anyone as the bear.

Lastly Carl's attention was caught by a pair of what can best be described as fox ladies. They were human-sized, but their heads looked distinctly vulpine. Narrow, tapered muzzles, a fiery orange fur coat matching the rest of their bodies. Behind each them swished a big, poofy tail. They chittered back and forth, occasionally shooting him a glance and bursting into giggles. When he caught one of them stealing a look she turned her head and winked at him.
11332132131.title: Carl looks around for a patron to ask for help

113321321312.content:
There was something strangely alluring about the two foxes and Carl felt his best chances of getting home alive laid with them. When they next looked over to him he waved, making them giggle. He took this as enough of an introduction to walk over to their table and join them.

"Hey there stranger, what's someone like you doing all the way out here?"

"Well, my friend wasn't having a very good day, so I took her out for drinks. Then she appears to have gotten a little too drunk to remember to take me back home. The name's Carl, by the way." He said, maintaining his confidence as best he could before the two fox ladies. They looked even prettier up close. Their piercing eyes and pointed muzzles were strangely cute. Most other days he would've thought sitting opposite literal fox women would be weird, but after what happened with Mira he had to accept that this was really possible. They both wore matching short skirts and a cute little top that provided an unsubtle and generous look at their breasts.

"Pleased to meet you, Carl. I'm Katja."

"And I'm Suzie. Now I think you might be in luck." The vixen said with a sly grin.

"How's that?" The man asked with a raised brow.

"We're spirit guides. We help lost souls to find their destination. And you sound pretty lost."

"Wow, really? That's great. I can pay you for your troubles if you~" Carl reached for his wallet but Katja interrupted him.

"Unless that wallet has gold in it, don't bother. Your paper money has no value here. Also, we only guide souls I'm afraid. You look a bit too much on the living side for us to help you." She smirked. He knew she wasn't being completely honest, but he was way too far out of his depth to even begin to guess what part of her words was false.

"I mean, you could say hi to Matroska over there. She's been looking at you like she'd love to take care of that scrumptious little body of yours." They giggled as he shot a glance over his shoulder, only to see they were talking about the bear woman. She blew him a kiss and a big wink. It was unnerving, almost as much as hearing the foxes describing him as 'scrumptious'.

"Can't you make an exception just this once? Please?" Carl pleaded, giving the foxes his best impression of puppy eyes. They giggled loudly before Katja let out a long performative sigh.

"Wellllll, I guess we could try to help him, what do you think, Suzie?"

"Oh, I suppose we could..." Her words lifted Carl's mood right away. "...for a price."

Now it was Carl's turn to sigh. He should've seen this coming a mile away. Of course the fox ladies would be tricksy, but they still sounded like they were his best bet. Hopefully this wouldn't cost him too much. For now the best path was to play along with them. He looked at them pleadingly and spoke up. "But I've got nothing to pay you with. My cash is worthless here according to you."

They laughed for a moment before Suzie explained. "Silly man, we know you're broke. We weren't talking about money. In order for us to do you this favor, you will have to do us a favor too. And I don't know about you, Katja, but I can think of a few things already."

"As much as I would love to stay here with you, I think it'll be quite a journey back to my home, so if it's all the same with you I'd like to get started with that."

Both foxes pout, but Carl was quick to soothe them. "But if you both are up for it, I wouldn't mind meeting up again. You're both very pretty and I would love to get to know you more."

Katja lets out a deep sigh. "I suppose you're right. I'll go pay our tab. Suzie, can you prepare the guy for the trip?"

She leans in, pushing her muzzle against Carl's cheek and planting a cute little kiss. The faint smell of alcohol on her breath couldn't distract him enough from the eerie tingling he felt radiating out from the site of the kiss. She scoots herself closer and puts a hand on his shoulder.

The sly fox holding him was thinking much the same, but she hadn't yet decided where to let the little man ride on her body.
