The damage done was too severe and Chester gulped as he realized there was only one thing left for him to do. He would make Simone's final moments as happy as he could.

Carefully the werebear cradled his date, guiding her lips towards his. They met in a passionate kiss. Chester tried to justify Simone's lack of movement by thinking he'd take charge. But it didn't stop the whole thing from being bittersweet. He'd killed the woman who loved him. Now he would make sure it would be painless.

Simone was barely able to discern what was happening anymore, her consciousness fading fast. She felt her date's kiss. It was strangely nice, but got lost amidst the rollercoaster of emotions she felt. All at once she felt angry at his clumsiness, betrayed by his monstrous nature and saddened that his brute strength had caused him to do this. Topping all these feelings was overwhelming numbness, the intense pain suppressed by her adrenaline. She was no medical professional, but she could tell no hospital would be able to save her. Chester held her close to his chest before giving her the last kind gesture he could think of.

The werebear grunted, flexing his muscles and ending his date's suffering. It took no more than a second to snap her spine with a dull crunch. He let out a sigh of relief, happy that her agony was over. He felt embarrassed, guilty that he couldn't control himself. Now his human date was dead. This wasn't supposed to have happened. He'd pictured them living happily together. But if she was this frail, perhaps it was better that he didn't grow too attached just yet. He sat for minutes, feeling Simone's body go cold whilst his inner turmoil played out. At the end of it he set her beside him on the couch and with a weary sigh he prepared to leave. Hopefully future dates wouldn't end this badly.

He looked over his shoulder to Simone one last time. Right at that moment his belly rumbled. The dinner she cooked was nice, but hardly enough to fill a big werebear like him up. And the way she was sitting there, she did look awfully appetizing. It'd be a shame to let her go to waste. "It's what she would've wanted." He muttered to himself as he approached his love one last time, drool leaking from his maw.

Chester left Simone's house with an awkward smile, patting his somewhat swollen belly. He slipped into the dark, pulling out his phone and loading up Monstr. Better luck next date...

12131.content:
Simone smiled, looking at her phone. This guy was certainly a character. A self-proclaimed pirate, he even put some of that corny pirate-speak in his texts to her. What was more interesting is his claims to have his own ship to sail the world and a desire for a strong woman by his side. Something exotic and dangerous, so why not a human? It made Simone feel a strange kind of special. It helped that he was quite easy on the eyes too. Handsome, tall, muscular. The thick, bristly fur and hyena-like muzzle were there too, of course. But the gnoll was a sexy beast in her mind.

Finally her attention was drawn to the front door, loud knocking echoing through her house. They had agreed before the date that she'd be wearing something casual. Something that she didn't mind getting damaged or wet. Those instructions alone had her fantasizing about what this Seafang might do to her in the bedroom, or captain's quarters as he'd said. More knocks followed as it seemed her date was an impatient one. She opened the door to find several gnolls waiting for her. None of them looked like the dashing one she'd been getting pictures from though.

"Good evening, madam." The lead gnoll spoke with a growly voice. English did not come easy to the beast, but it tried to sound polite all the same. More distressing was the smell. She had few illusions about gnolls being clean, but the piercing stink of sweat radiated of them like a vile aura.

"The captain has requested we escort you to our beautiful vessel. She be close by in the river. If you would please follow us. We'd hate for this to get... unpleasant." The others cackled with that last word. Each of them was a foot taller than Simone and twice as wide. They seemed almost disappointed when the woman simply nodded, grabbed her coat and closed the door behind herself.

"Okay then, gents, lead away." She said cheerily.

"Would the lady care to be carried?" The lead gnoll offered. With a cheeky grin Simone nodded and in a flash she was hoisted off her feet and thrown over the gnoll's shoulder. She gave a sigh, not sure why she expecting any different. Doubt set in as the sweaty smell was even worse up close. The other gnolls chuckled at eachother, some of them using the opportunity to try and sneak a look up her skirt. Thankfully the beast's broad shoulder was comfortable enough. She stayed calm as the pack made way for the river, making small talk with the gnolls.

"So how long have you guys known Seafang?"

"Arr, he found us all as pups, raised us like his sons. Instilled within us a love of the sea, raiding and plundering. He inspires us all and each of us would follow him into hell if he ordered it." The lead gnoll said, sounding surprisingly emotional through his snarling voice. The others all quietly nodded along. "This crew, she be one big happy family." The beast continued.

"Now we all drift across the endless waters, our home ever with us." Another crewmember added, earning his own round of agreement. Their chat didn't last much longer as they had arrived at their destination. Simone was set down as gently as the lead gnoll could muster and turned around.

"Avast, me datey!" A boisterous voice called out. His first line to her was a dad joke. Simone instantly knew the story of Seafang raising the other crew had to be true now. But as she saw him she was more than convinced a bad taste in humor wouldn't dampen this date one bit.

Seafang stood tall and proud, a toothy smile on his face and an outfit that had to be seen to be believed. A long, ornately detailed duster that looked straight out of a pirate novel. Gold trimmings, fine leatherworking and a scabbard to its side for a large broadsword, he had it all. His face looked as ruggedly handsome as ever. If there were any signs that he was older than the crew, his appearance didn't show them. He wore a stained white undershirt and his fingers were coated in large golden rings and jewels. His pants matched the duster coat and his large boots were shining as he struck a powerful pose. Simone was certainly impressed by the captain, but his ship was quite a sight too.

121312.content:
The gnoll pirate ship looked awe-inspiring and terrifying in equal measure. A rusted hulk, patches of crudely fitted metal covering holes from bow to stern. It looked like an old navy warship. The cannons were still there, but they had been loaded with what could only be described as giant grappling hooks. Gnolls were going about their business everywhere, scurrying across the deck. Most of the ship's doors had been removed and the holes crudely cut bigger. These beasts looked like they would struggle inside a regular vessel. It made Simone all the more curious to see what they had done to the inner workings.

"All aboard! The sea, she be waiting." The captain announced grandly.

Simone followed the crewmen that carried her here up the gangplank and with a loud, rumbling blast of the horn they set off. Seafang came down to greet her more personally. To her surprise he didn't reek as badly as the others. There was still a very distinct smell of unwashed gnoll in the air, but she had worried that he had gotten his rank by being the smelliest gnoll of them all.

"Welcome aboard the Slavering Raider, miss Andrewson. I be Seafang, in case that wasn't clear yet. I look forward to this date. Be assured, the crew has been informed that you are not to be harmed or harassed in any way, lest they meet my wrath. Though if you warm up to these cute little puppies I am sure you'll find us all more than happy to share your love." He explained with a toothy smile. Simone breathed a sigh of relief, knowing how some of the crew were leering at her. But before she could get comfortable the captain leaned in, putting a hand on the wall behind her and breathing heavily in her face.

"But if you hurt any of my beloved family... There will be no safe haven in the world that can protect you." He growled threateningly before catching himself intimidating his date and stepping back. She gulped. But Simone didn't start texting this gnoll through Monstr because she was afraid. She steeled herself and turned her attention to the captain's first mate. He'd been standing idly, seemingly waiting for orders of some kind.

"Aw, I don't think I'd ever be able to hurt a big, strong beast like you." She said seductively, reaching up to scratch him behind the ear. The first mate's tongue lolled out the side of his maw as he panted happily.

"Mister Breach, do you not have a place to be? Go and make sure the crew are ready for our next adventure." Seafang commanded sternly. Simone just gave him a smile.

"You're not getting jealous already, are you? I just want to show you I appreciate your crew too." She said, her voice drenched in sugar. "But I'm not here because I appreciate them. I'm here because I want you." Simone put a finger on the gnoll's chest. His heart went aflutter as he felt his love for her be reinforced by her confidence.

"Then you shall see that Seafang leaves no-one wanting. Come, my treasure, the men have prepared a feast for us all." He extended an arm and she took it. Together they walked along the deck of his warship towards the bridge tower. She was curious to see where this would lead, but she hadn't expected to see anything like what the gnolls had done to the ship.

The inside of the steel hull had been almost completely gutted. Only a framework of thick, metal pillars was still left to keep the place from collapsing under its own weight. There looked to be just one lower deck left, a furred frenzy of crewmen moving around. At the front and the back of this cavernous metal hall were holes in the floor, gnolls jumping in an out. Probably the storage hold. Up above she could see the interior of the gutted comms tower, only a few crewmen staying on their posts to steer the ship and keep a weather eye out for opportunities. The back of the tower had still been left somewhat intact, forming the only real separate room within this large shell. It was even more remarkable because it had an actual door in it, not just a crudely torn hole. It was probably Seafang's personal quarters.

It was almost time for dinner and the crew had set up a long table in the middle of the room, covering it with stained tablecloths and preparing an elaborate meal. The food turned Simone's stomach a little as it was very clear gnolls didn't bother with such fineries as cooking their food. Chunks of raw, bloodied meat were stacked on dirty dishes. Seafang could see his date's discomfort and spoke calmly.

"Fret not, I had mister Breach prepare you something more to your tastes. You'll have to forgive his cooking skills, he tries his best." He surprised his date by hoisting her off her feet and hopping down, landing with a heavy thump and setting her down beside him again. "Sorry about that, the Slavering Raider isn't the most... human-friendly vessel in these seas." He mused, prompting a chorus of suppressed giggles from the crew. The first mate emerged again, pointing the captain and his date to their seats and serving them both a roasted meal. Simone was pleasantly surprised. It looked a bit crude, but edible. What surprised her more was the captain being served a similar dish.

"I will not be sitting here and letting you feel all awkward being the only one to eat cooked food. Anyone got a problem with that, my boot is more than ready to listen to their complaints." He said brashly, putting a smile on her face. Of course there were limits to what the gnolls would do to accommodate her and cutlery was probably a bit too much to ask around here. Striving to fit in with the beasts she picked up the roast and dug in.

"You are no longer bound to this place."

I've got a large farm where nobody will bother us and we can have all the fun we want together. Also, I'd heard that you would be amazing to make love to and those legends have greatly undersold the truth. Last night was the best night of my life."

Tim turned beet red hearing this woman gush about him and his sexual prowess. He didn't have much of a frame of reference, but he could honestly admit that living with her might not be the worst thing to happen to him. It seemed like the least he could do to reward her for ending his imprisonment. Not to mention that last night was pretty damn epic for him as well.

"So, what do you say? Are you ready to leave this maze behind and come with me?"

The minotaur struggled to keep it together. Part of him wanted to hug her so much she'd snap in half, but for now he contained his gratitude and nodded. He swept her off her feet and cradled her in his powerful arms. Alice giggled as he walked briskly down the corridors towards the entrance. The steadily hastening rhythm of his footsteps belied his excitement, putting an even wider smile on her face. The bull man stopped near the front door, setting his date down. She walked outside and beckoned him over. Cautiously he took a step out of the front door. The oppressive force coercing him back was there, but something felt different. He pushed on and to his amazement he could feel the resistance peter out. What few last vestiges were left soon faded away. She had done it. The first human to meet him in millenia and she had freed him from the labyrinth. Tim felt like the luckiest minotaur in the world.

"Congratulations, you're free. But now that you are, have you considered my offer? You and I would live together long and happily on my farm. I'll introduce you to all my friends. But I understand if you want to go out and see more of the world than just my little home. I can't expect you to trade sitting in one place all the time for sitting in another."

"I've spent thousands of years cooped up in here, I can handle a few decades with you." He said calmly. The sad truth was that in his millenia-long lifespan, the time he'd spend with her would be brief. But if last night was any indication, it would certainly be memorable.

Slim was hiking down the narrow trail, eager to meet up again with his date. She'd been sending him all kinds of teasing messages, looking forward to their date. He wasn't wholly sure what she had in mind, but he was happy to just meet someone like her. The parking lot was relatively close by, though he didn't plan to go all the way there. They agreed to meet up a little bit off the trail so any other hikers that might be there wouldn't cause a scene.

A few minutes later he heard someone up ahead on the trail. Slim quickly hid behind a few trees, his pudgy frame making it difficult to be fully concealed. Carefully he peeked to see if this was just some random hiker or his date. He'd never felt this nervous around humans before. Normally he'd just barge down the path and they could get out of the way or else. Why was he suddenly acting like this? He couldn't ponder on his little anxieties any longer when he heard a distinct voice call out.

"Slim? You out there?"

It felt like a boulder just slipped off the frog-man's shoulders. He emerged from behind the tree, waving his arm and greeting her. "Hey there. Good to see you again." Jessica didn't even seem remotely shocked to see him skulking through the woods like that. He quickly closed the distance and extended a large hand. She felt a touch intimidated as the pudgy monster stood a solid three feet taller than her, but she wouldn't show it. His skin was a little damp and remarkably smooth, surprising giving his rough outdoorsy lifestyle in his swamp. She giggled as she could tell he really held back on his handshake, not wanting to hurt her. Slim cleared his throat and finally found the words he wanted to say.

"So Jessica, shall we go to my place? I mean, we can go somewhere else too if you've got plans, but I reckon most human places might give me some weird looks." He got increasingly flustered by the word, seemingly forgetting he was by now holding on to her hand for an awkwardly long amount of time.

Jessica calmly put her other hand on his and in her most soothing voice responded. "That would be lovely."

"Do... do you want me to... carry you?" Slim asked nervously, finally letting go of her hand. Jessica blushed, thinking about the sensation of those big, strong arms lifting her off her feet. "Only if I'm not too heavy for you. I don't want to be a burden."

The frog-man smiles and leans down, one arm behind her back and another behind her thighs. In one seamless sweep he picks her up, cradling her like a child. He blushes brightly, giving her a reassuring look. "You're even lighter than I imagined." He flexes his muscles a little, rocking his date back and forth to get her as comfortable as possible. Jessica was feeling more than a little flustered. Firstly by him picking her up with such ease and secondly by him seeming having no problems carrying her. She thought he'd give it a gallant try and set her back down after a few steps, but he really didn't mind carrying her in his arms for miles. It felt strangely romantic, the two exchanging many amorous looks on the way to Slim's home.

The landscape quickly turned from the small woods near the parking space to the familiar swampland that housed the frog-man. His humble abode wasn't too much further. It was a ramshackle construction, but Slim had spent the last week repairing many of the holes in the roof and tidying up the worst of the trash. He hasn't had to give a damn about the state of the place for years, since nobody ever visited him. But now he wanted to really try and impress the woman in his arms. By his estimate he was doing a good job so far, given all the loving looks she gave him.

Along the way they talked about many things. Their shared love for nature, how cute dogs were and how aggravating most other hikers were. Though their methods for dealing with the worst of them did differ a little. Jessica proudly explained how she told off a few hikers that were littering. Slim responded by talking about how he followed a few litterbugs and ate them whole. His big belly grumbled a little at the memory, making his date feel nervous. He quickly reassured her though that he would never dare to eat someone as pretty as her. They arrived at his home shortly thereafter and the frog-man carefully carried his date inside, finally setting her down on his couch. Her perched his heavy rear down beside her, unsure of what to do next.

"Alright guys, here he is. This is Francis, the human I was talking about. We met on Monstr and we had the best date ever yesterday. And since he didn't have anything to do today he agreed to stay a little longer and meet you guys. Francis, meet Lola."

The cow woman stepped forward and reached out a hand. But when he shook it she pulled him off his feet and into her chest. It was softer than the heavily muscled appearance would have him believe. The bearhug that followed was anything but soft though. She giggled a little, clearly holding back. Nevertheless the stoner wheezed and patted her chest, trying to tap out of the uncomfortable hold. Rheina saw her human struggling in the strong grip and joked at her friend. "Hah, you squeeze him any harder and he'll pass out."

"That's Ann'Zaquuul'Morr'Damnatus, or Anna for short. She's from the Circle of Greed. Don't let her diminutive figure fool you, she's got favors running from a lot of demons around here. We don't need bribes to help her though, we just like her a lot."

Anna blushed and smiled, giving the human a quick glance. He shook her hand, all the jewels and glimmers on her sleeve jingling as he did. When he pulled his hand away he found two ornate golden coins in it. Francis held them out to the goblin.

info.brief_description: Adventurous humans and lonely monsters looking for love
info.description:
A new app has crept up from some dark corner of the internet promising its users the ability to date all manner of monsters, be it ancient myths and legends or other strange creatures of fantasy. Discarded mostly as a prank or some elaborate hoax, only a few people have found it so far and have given it a try. Those who took the plunge also soon discovered that monster standards for a 'date' can differ wildly from their expectations. Will they even survive their romantic encounters?

The rules:

1: Everyone involved is 18+, no underage characters
2: Gore is alright, but try not to go overboard with gratuitous descriptions
3: No Scat/watersports
4: Characters can die, but don't kill them off too quickly. Give the date a few chapters worth of story before hitting the fatal conclusion.
5: Let's avoid pre-established characters for now. Import species and such as you will, but don't haul in characters from other franchises. I may relax this rule later when there's more chapters, but for now attempt to create your own monsters and people.
6: Dates need not be straight. M/M, F/F and more are all welcome.


If you have any questions about this interactive, feel free to send me an e-mail.
